title: Accessibility Claim Without Burden Acknowledgment
context: Arguments about AI democratizing art creation are presented as unambiguous goods. The transfer of this claim (from advocate to listener) appears clean: 'AI tools make art creation accessible to everyone.'
pressure: The hidden cost is not transferred: accessibility to *creation* does not equal accessibility to *audience*, *market viability*, or *economic sustainability*. A person can now generate images but cannot necessarily sell them, build a career, or be seen. The burden (market saturation, attention scarcity) is omitted from the transfer.
axiom_trigger: Axiom 3 (Clean Transfer) is violated. The claim is incomplete. A clean transfer would include: 'AI makes creation accessible, but market access remains scarce. This may help hobbyists and may harm professionals.'
clean_outcome: System failure documented. The transfer is poisoned because it omits the burden side. A clean version would name both the gift and the cost, allowing the receiver to make informed judgment rather than receiving a half-truth disguised as liberation.
